displayModel.summary: Executes a BAPIFunction over a queued Remote Function Call (qRFC).

operations.description:
This operation executes a BAPIFunction over a queued Remote Function Call (qRFC).
A qRFC is an extension of a transactional RFC (tRFC) that ensures that individual steps are processed in sequence. This guarantees that multiple logical unit of work (LUW) transactions are processed in the order specified by the application. tRFC can be serialized using inbound and outbound queues, hence the name queued RFC.

qRFC is best used for:
  • Extension of the Transactional RFC
  • Defined processing sequence

qRFC is recommended if you want to guarantee that several transactions are processed in a predefined order.

parameters.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

description.value: This is the amount of memory that will be allocated in order to consume the stream and provide random access to it. If the stream contains more data than can be fit into this buffer, then it will be expanded by according to the bufferSizeIncrement attribute, with an upper limit of maxInMemorySize.

This is by how much will be buffer size by expanded if it exceeds its initial size. Setting a value of zero or lower will mean that the buffer should not expand, meaning that a STREAM_MAXIMUM_SIZE_EXCEEDED error will be raised when the buffer gets full.
This is the maximum amount of memory that will be used. If more than that is used then a STREAM_MAXIMUM_SIZE_EXCEEDED error will be raised. A value lower or equal to zero means no limit.
The unit in which all these attributes are expressed
Defines the maximum memory that the stream should use to keep data in memory. If more than that is consumed then it will start to buffer the content on disk.
The unit in which maxInMemorySize is expressed

This configuration allows the input stream to be read only once. It will not allow to seek randomly which will limit the transformations that DW can perform on this stream. Use this option for use cases which just require moving data around from one system to another to get optimum performance.

operations.name: retrieveIdoc

displayModel.summary: Sends an IDocument to SAP over an RFC

operations.description:
This operation sends an IDocument to SAP over an RFC.
An RFC can be one of two types for IDocuments: 1. Transactional (tRFC): A special form of asynchronous Remote Function Call (aRFC) that ensures transaction-like execution of processing steps that were originally executed autonomously and that executes the called function module in the RFC server only once, even if the data is sent multiple times.
tRFC is an asynchronous communication method that executes the called function module in the RFC server only once, even if the data is sent multiple times.

2. Queued (qRFC): A qRFC is an extension of tRFC that guarantees that multiple LUWs are processed in the order specified by the application, using inbound and outbound queues, hence the name queued RFC.

qRFC is best used as an extension of tRFC to define a processing sequence. Both of these types have a TID handler.
The implementation of qRFC is recommended if you want to guarantee that several transactions are processed in a predefined order.

operations.name: send

displayModel.summary: Executes a BAPIFunction over a Synchronous Remote Function Call (sRFC).

operations.description:
This operation executes a BAPIFunction over a Synchronous Remote Function Call (sRFC), which requires both client and server to be available for communication or data transfer and also to be available to return a result immediately after the execution.
sRFC is best used for:
  • Communication between systems
  • Communication between SAP Web Application Server to SAP GUI

messageSources.description: This source listens for incoming IDocs.

displayModel.summary: Gateway host.

parameters.description: This is the name of the host running the gateway handler. SAP Gateway is a development framework used to connect non-SAP applications to SAP applications. You can configure the SAP Gateway host to be the trusted system using an RFC destination.
parameters.name: gatewayHost

displayModel.summary: Gateway service.

parameters.description: Either the name or service port for the gateway service of the SAP system
parameters.name: gatewayService

displayModel.summary: Program ID.

parameters.description: SAP system program ID that is registered on the gateway. Must be unique for the given gateway.
parameters.name: programID

displayModel.summary: Connection count.

parameters.description: This parameter indicates the number of connections to register on the gateway. If there is more than one connection, handler requests are processed in parallel. For example, if two connections are set, this will create two handler workers or threads that are going to handle requests in parallel, almost like having two sources start together.
parameters.name: connectionCount

configurations.name: sap
configurations.description: This refers to the default configuration for SAP extension outbound elements.

parameters.description: The identifier of this element used to reference it in other components
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.

description.value: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.
A scalar time value for the maximum amount of time a dynamic configuration instance should be allowed to be idle before it's considered eligible for expiration
A time unit that qualifies the maxIdleTime attribute

parameters.name: expirationPolicy

displayModel.summary: Canonical name of the encoding.

parameters.description: Canonical name of the encoding. See Oracle's supported encodings at https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/guides/intl/encoding.doc.html.
parameters.name: encoding

displayModel.summary: Default IDoc version
Disable jco internal cache.

parameters.description: Flag that indicates whether to use the JCo internal cache. Set this flag to true to use the SAP JCo internal cache. By default, JCo stores the metadata after the first call and populates that template in the following calls. This flag applies to both functions and sources.
parameters.name: disableJcoInternalCache

displayModel.summary: Evaluate response flag.

parameters.description: Flag that indicates whether to throw an exception or let the user handle it as another result. This flag is an exception or logging mechanism you use to specify whether a message throws an exception (E) or is treated as a result with a warning (W). If you set the flag to true and an E message is returned, an exception is thrown with that message. If W is returned, a warning message is logged.
parameters.name: evaluateResponseFlag

displayModel.summary: Log trace flag.

parameters.description: Flag that indicates whether to log the trace on the Mule server. Set this to true to log a trace.
parameters.name: logTraceFlag

displayModel.summary: Use SAP default format only when working with BAPIFunctions over sRFC

parameters.description: Parameter added to support the Mule 3 format for returning SAP values. Used to parse a JCoField. If set to true, values are returned as strings with the original SAP format. If set to false, values are converted to the corresponding Java objects, serialized, and returned.
parameters.name: useSAPFormat

displayModel.summary: Use SAP default format only when working with BAPI function listener

parameters.description: Parameter added to support the Mule 3 format for returning SAP values. Used to parse a JCoField. If set to true, values are returned as strings with the original SAP format. If set to false, values are converted to the corresponding Java objects, serialized, and returned.
parameters.name: useSAPFormatOnFunctionListener

displayModel.summary: The two-digit system number (sysnr) of the SAP system.

parameters.description: Two-digit system number (sysnr) of the SAP system
parameters.name: systemNumber

displayModel.summary: Three-digit client number. Preserve leading zeros if they appear in the number.

parameters.description: Three-digit client number. Leading zeroes are preserved if they appear in the number.
parameters.name: client

displayModel.summary: Destination name.

parameters.description: Connector generates an identifier of the destination. If none is set, then a random value is created.
parameters.name: destinationName

displayModel.summary: Code of the language used by the connector.

parameters.description: Connector uses a language code that determines the code page used for communicating between the SAP Adapter and the application server.
parameters.name: language

displayModel.summary: Extended properties.

parameters.description: Connector uses this to pass in all the database server-specific connection parameters.
parameters.name: extendedProperties

displayModel.summary: Path to the X.509 certificate.

parameters.description: Path to the X.509 certificate. This is required when the connector is working as a client.
parameters.name: path

parameters.name: applicationServerHost

parameters.description: Configuration for message server usage
parameters.name: messageServer

displayModel.summary: Enable/disable Remote Function Call (RFC) tracing on the server.

parameters.description: Enable or disable RFC trace on the server
parameters.name: traceFromServerFlag

displayModel.summary: Enable/disable CPIC tracing on the server.

parameters.description: Enable or disable CPIC trace on the server
parameters.name: cpicTracingLevel

parameters.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

description.value: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy
The reconnection strategy to use
How often (in ms) to reconnect
If false, the reconnection strategy will run in a separate, non-blocking thread
How many reconnection attempts to make
How often (in ms) to reconnect
If false, the reconnection strategy will run in a separate, non-blocking thread

extensionModel.description: Class that has an overall configuration for the SAP extension.

displayModel.summary: Parsing option for enabling the field value checking mechanism in accordance with the respective IDoc field metadata.
Parsing option for ignoring unknown fields, e.g. when parsing with older IDoc metadata.
Parsing option for ignoring character range check errors in accordance with the declared XML specification version.
Parsing option for disabling the field data type checking mechanism in accordance with the respective IDoc field metadata.
Parsing option for refusing XML documents that declare to use an unknown XML specification version
Parsing option for refusing XML documents that declare to use the XML specification version 1.0
Parsing option for refusing XML documents that declare to use the XML specification version 1.1.
Parsing option for accepting only XML documents that declare to use the XML specification version 1.0
Parsing option for accepting only XML documents that declare to use the XML specification version 1.1.
Parsing option for accepting only XML documents that declare to use the XML specification version 1.0 or 1.1
displayModel.displayName: Parse Accept Only XML Version 1.0 to 1.1

displayModel.summary: Rendering option for including also all empty tags in the resulting XML document
Rendering option for ignoring character range check errors in accordance with the used XML specification version.
Rendering option for ignoring escape character errors within XML tags in accordance with the used IDocXML format.
Rendering option for omitting the XML declaration section in the resulting XML document.
Rendering option for writing also an optional XML encoding declaration attribute into the resulting XML document.
Rendering option for substituting invalid characters within IDoc field values with the number sign '#' (U+0023).
Rendering option for inserting CR (Carriage Return) characters into the resulting XML document.
Rendering option for inserting CR+LF (Carriage Return and Line Feed) characters into the resulting XML document.
Rendering option for inserting LF (Line Feed) characters into the resulting XML document.
Rendering option for inserting TAB and CR (Tabulators and Carriage Return) characters into the resulting XML document.
Rendering option for inserting TAB and CR+LF (Tabulators, Carriage Return and Line Feed) characters into the resulting XML document.
Rendering option for inserting TAB and LF (Tabulators and Line Feed) characters into the resulting XML document.
Rendering option for creating an XML document compliant to the XML specification version 1.0
Rendering option for creating an XML document compliant to the XML specification version 1.1
The host of the message server.
System ID of the SAP system.
The port used by the connector to log into the message server.
Group name of the messaging server.
SAP router string to use for a system protected by a firewall.

extensionModel.name: SAP
